intro: Marumia leprosa, commonly known as the Leprous Marumia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly rough texture. Marumia leprosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
